metadata.title: Benchmark 50×2 — Standard RAG + Orchestrator Evaluation
metadata.note: Standard RAG: Pinecone vector search from ingested datasets. Orchestrator: routing + multi-engine queries.

questions.question: In what country is Normandy located?
questions.expected_answer: France

questions.question: When was the first season of SpongeBob SquarePants aired?
What is the capital of Japan?
questions.expected_answer: Tokyo

questions.question: Who wrote Romeo and Juliet?
questions.expected_answer: William Shakespeare

questions.question: What is penicillin?
questions.expected_answer: An antibiotic discovered by Alexander Fleming

questions.question: What is the theory of relativity?
questions.expected_answer: Einstein's theory describing gravity and spacetime

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.expected_answer: Pacific Ocean

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.expected_answer: Leonardo da Vinci

questions.question: What is photosynthesis?
questions.expected_answer: Process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy

questions.question: What is the speed of light?
questions.expected_answer: approximately 299,792 kilometers per second

questions.question: Who discovered gravity?
questions.expected_answer: Isaac Newton

questions.question: What is DNA?
questions.expected_answer: Deoxyribonucleic acid, molecule carrying genetic instructions

questions.question: When did World War II end?
What is the chemical formula for water?
questions.expected_answer: H2O

questions.question: Who was the first person to walk on the moon?
questions.expected_answer: Neil Armstrong

questions.expected_answer: Ancient series of walls and fortifications in China

questions.question: What is the currency of the United Kingdom?
questions.expected_answer: Pound sterling

questions.question: What is machine learning?
questions.expected_answer: A subset of artificial intelligence where systems learn from data

questions.question: Who is the author of Harry Potter?
questions.expected_answer: J.K. Rowling

questions.question: What causes earthquakes?
questions.expected_answer: Movement of tectonic plates

questions.question: What is the Amazon rainforest?
questions.expected_answer: The largest tropical rainforest in the world, located in South America

questions.question: Who invented the telephone?
questions.expected_answer: Alexander Graham Bell

questions.question: What is the Pythagorean theorem?
questions.expected_answer: a² + b² = c², relationship between sides of a right triangle

questions.question: What is the European Union?
questions.expected_answer: Political and economic union of European countries

questions.question: Who was Cleopatra?
questions.expected_answer: Last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt

questions.question: What is a black hole?
questions.expected_answer: Region of spacetime where gravity is so strong nothing can escape

questions.question: What is the Sahara Desert?
questions.expected_answer: Largest hot desert in the world, located in Africa

questions.question: Who composed the Four Seasons?
questions.expected_answer: Antonio Vivaldi

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water?
questions.expected_answer: 100 degrees Celsius

questions.question: What is the United Nations?
questions.expected_answer: International organization for cooperation among sovereign states

questions.question: What is the Hubble Space Telescope?
questions.expected_answer: Space telescope launched by NASA in 1990

questions.question: Who was Galileo Galilei?
questions.expected_answer: Italian astronomer and physicist, father of modern observational astronomy

questions.question: What is the human genome?
questions.expected_answer: Complete set of nucleic acid sequences for humans

questions.question: What is blockchain technology?
questions.expected_answer: Distributed ledger technology for secure, transparent transactions

questions.question: Who was Napoleon Bonaparte?
questions.expected_answer: French military leader and Emperor

questions.question: What is the International Space Station?
questions.expected_answer: Modular space station in low Earth orbit, international partnership

questions.question: What is climate change?
questions.expected_answer: Long-term shift in global temperatures and weather patterns

questions.question: Who discovered penicillin?
questions.expected_answer: Alexander Fleming

questions.question: What is the Rosetta Stone?
questions.expected_answer: Ancient Egyptian artifact with text in three scripts

questions.question: What is GDP?
questions.expected_answer: Gross Domestic Product, total value of goods and services produced

questions.question: Who was Mahatma Gandhi?
questions.expected_answer: Leader of the Indian independence movement, advocate of nonviolent resistance

questions.question: What is a tsunami?
questions.expected_answer: Series of ocean waves caused by underwater earthquakes or volcanic eruptions

questions.question: What is CRISPR?
questions.expected_answer: Gene editing technology for modifying DNA sequences

questions.question: Who was Marie Antoinette?
questions.expected_answer: Queen of France, wife of Louis XVI, executed during the French Revolution

questions.question: What is the ozone layer?
questions.expected_answer: Layer of ozone in the stratosphere that absorbs ultraviolet radiation

questions.question: What are antibiotics?
questions.expected_answer: Medicines that fight bacterial infections

questions.question: Who built the pyramids of Giza?
questions.expected_answer: Ancient Egyptians

questions.question: What is the function of the heart?
questions.expected_answer: Pump blood throughout the body

questions.question: What is the Renaissance?
questions.expected_answer: Cultural movement in Europe from the 14th to 17th century

questions.question: Who was Albert Einstein?
questions.expected_answer: Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity

Who discovered penicillin?
questions.expected_answer: Alexander Fleming

questions.question: What does NASA study and how much cash does GreenEnergy Corp have?
questions.expected_answer: NASA uses Nuclear Energy; GreenEnergy Corp had $900M cash at end 2023

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water?
questions.expected_answer: 100 degrees Celsius

questions.question: What was the operating income for all companies in Q1 2023?
questions.expected_answer: TechVision $465.9M, GreenEnergy $184.7M, HealthPlus $48.2M

questions.question: What is the connection between the World Health Organization and the United Nations?
questions.expected_answer: WHO is a subset of the United Nations

questions.question: Who was Winston Churchill?
questions.expected_answer: British Prime Minister during World War II

questions.question: What products does TechVision sell in the AI/ML category and what is their revenue trend?
questions.expected_answer: VisionAI Platform and VisionAI Edge; Revenue grew from $4.25B to $6.745B (2020-2023)

questions.question: Which Nobel Prize winners are in the knowledge graph and what was their contribution?
questions.expected_answer: Einstein (Relativity), Curie (radioactivity), Mandela (anti-apartheid)

questions.question: What is the total debt of HealthPlus Labs and who is connected to the city of Princeton?
questions.expected_answer: HealthPlus total debt ~$140M (ST+LT 2023); Einstein connected to Princeton

questions.question: List the products sold by GreenEnergy Corp
questions.expected_answer: SolarMax 400W, SolarMax 600W, WindTurbo 5kW, PowerVault 10kWh, PowerVault 20kWh, GridManager Pro

questions.question: What technology preceded the Internet?
questions.expected_answer: Electricity, Telephone, Steam Engine

questions.question: What is DNA and what role does it play in genetics?
questions.expected_answer: Deoxyribonucleic acid carries genetic instructions for development

questions.question: What was the EPS difference between TechVision Inc and GreenEnergy Corp in 2023?
questions.expected_answer: TechVision basic EPS $16.17 vs GreenEnergy $13.29

questions.question: Where is CERN located and what does it study?
questions.expected_answer: CERN is connected to Zurich, studies Nuclear Energy

questions.question: What diseases does vaccination protect against and how many medical employees does HealthPlus have?
questions.expected_answer: Vaccination protects against Influenza and COVID-19; HealthPlus has employees in various departments

questions.question: What is the ozone layer?
questions.expected_answer: Layer in stratosphere that absorbs UV radiation

questions.question: Which company had the highest revenue growth between 2020 and 2023?
questions.expected_answer: HealthPlus Labs with 260% growth

questions.question: What is the path from Alan Turing to Google through the knowledge graph?
questions.expected_answer: Turing → AI → Google, or Turing → Cambridge → Stanford → Google

questions.question: Explain what is photosynthesis and what is its chemical equation
questions.expected_answer: Process converting light to chemical energy, 6CO2 + 6H2O → C6H12O6 + 6O2

questions.question: What was the total assets growth of TechVision from 2020 to 2023 and who are the key scientists in the graph?
questions.expected_answer: Assets grew from $5.4B to $7.924B; Key scientists: Einstein, Curie, Newton, Darwin, Turing, Fleming

questions.question: What are HealthPlus Labs' quarterly revenues for 2023?
Which artists worked in Paris according to the knowledge graph?
questions.expected_answer: Pablo Picasso, Vincent van Gogh

questions.question: Who was Nikola Tesla and what was his rivalry with Edison?
questions.expected_answer: Tesla was an inventor, both connected to Electricity in New York City

questions.question: What is the average salary across all departments at GreenEnergy?
questions.expected_answer: Average salary calculation across departments

questions.question: What is the Pythagorean theorem and who invented it?
questions.expected_answer: a² + b² = c², attributed to Pythagoras

questions.question: What was TechVision's interest income in 2023 and where was the World Wide Web created?
questions.expected_answer: Interest income $45M; WWW created at CERN

questions.question: What is the balance sheet total liabilities for all companies at end of 2023?
questions.expected_answer: TechVision $1.775B, GreenEnergy $1.184B, HealthPlus $320M

questions.question: Which universities study Artificial Intelligence?
questions.expected_answer: MIT, Stanford University

questions.question: What is quantum computing?
questions.expected_answer: Computing using quantum mechanical phenomena like superposition and entanglement

questions.question: How does HealthPlus Labs' operating income compare to its R&D spending in 2023?
questions.expected_answer: Operating income $218.8M, R&D $288M - R&D exceeds operating income

questions.question: What is the connection between Louis Pasteur and disease prevention?
questions.expected_answer: Pasteur created vaccination which protects against Influenza and COVID-19

questions.question: List the top 3 companies by stockholders equity at end of 2023 and explain who Einstein was connected to
questions.expected_answer: TechVision $6.149B, GreenEnergy $3.276B, HealthPlus $795M; Einstein connected to Princeton, Nobel Foundation, Theory of Relativity

questions.question: What is CRISPR technology used for?
questions.expected_answer: Gene editing and modification of DNA sequences

questions.question: What was GreenEnergy Corp's cost of goods sold in 2022?
What museums are connected to Washington D.C. in the knowledge graph?
questions.expected_answer: Smithsonian Institution

questions.question: What is the French Revolution?
questions.expected_answer: Period of political and social upheaval in France starting in 1789

questions.question: What products does HealthPlus sell and who is connected to the Nobel Foundation?
questions.expected_answer: GenomeScan, ImmunoBoost, NeuroShield, MedAssist AI, PatientHub; Einstein, Curie, Mandela connected to Nobel Foundation

questions.question: What is the retained earnings for GreenEnergy Corp at end of 2023?
Describe the relationship chain from Alexander Fleming to COVID-19 in the knowledge graph
questions.expected_answer: Fleming → Penicillin → Tuberculosis; parallel: Vaccination → COVID-19, both via medical connections
